snippet: For years, residents of the strategic northern province have been at the mercy of corrupt or inept government and an abusive police force.
abstract: Interviews with officials and residents of Kunduz, Afghanistan, show that Taliban seizure of provincial capital Kunduz City is seen as failure by Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani to gain province's loyalty; many locals say they had lost confidence in Afghan government even before assault, due to succession of corrupt, ineffective officials and abuses by Afghan Local Police.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jawad Sukhanyar and Ahmad Shakib from Kabul; Najim Rahim from Kunduz, Afghanistan; and Douglas Schorzman from New York.

lead_paragraph: For years, residents of the strategic northern province have been at the mercy of corrupt or inept government and an abusive police force.

headline.main: For Afghans in Kunduz, Taliban Assault Is Just the Latest Affront
headline.print_headline: Taliban Assault Is Just the Latest Affront for Afghans in Kunduz
